manual_migration.description: The Bayesian integration now also updates the probability if the observed `to_state`, `above`, `below`, or `value_template` evaluates to `False` rather than only `True`. So it is no longer required to have duplicate, complementary entries for each binary state. Please remove the mirrored entry for `{entity}`.
manual_migration.title: Manual YAML fix required for Bayesian

no_prob_given_false.description: In the Bayesian integration `prob_given_false` is now a required configuration variable as there was no mathematical rationale for the previous default value. Please add this to your `configuration.yml` for `bayesian/{entity}`. These observations will be ignored until you do.
no_prob_given_false.title: Manual YAML addition required for Bayesian

reload.name: [%key:common::action::reload%]
reload.description: Reloads bayesian sensors from the YAML-configuration.

user.title: Add a Bayesian Sensor
user.description: Create a binary sensor which combines the state from multiple sensors.

data_description.probability_threshold: The probability above which the sensor will show as 'on'
data_description.prior: The baseline probabilty the sensor should be on, if you knew nothing else about the state of the entities below

observation_selector.title: Add an observation
observation_selector.description: One by one, add an observation that will inform the bayesian sensor. Each observation will update the proability of the Bayesian sensor if it is detected, or if its inverse is detected. If the state of the entity becomes `UNAVAILABLE` or `UNKOWN` it will be ignored. If more than one `state` or more than 1 `numeric_range` is configured for the same entity then inverse detections will be ignored.

state.title: Add a Bayesian Sensor
state.description: Add an observation which examines the state of an entity.

data_description.to_state: The state of the sensor to be detected
data_description.prob_given_true: The probability of detecting the above state when the Bayesian sensor should be on
data_description.prob_given_false: The probability of *not* detecting the above state when the Bayesian sensor should be on

numeric_state.title: [%key:component::bayesian::config::step::state::title%]
numeric_state.description: Add an observation which examines the value of a numeric entity.

data_description.above: Optional - the lower end of the numeric range. Values exactly matching this will not count
data_description.below: Optional - the upper end of the numeric range. Values matching this will only count if more than one range is configured for the same entity.

template.title: [%key:component::bayesian::config::step::state::title%]
template.description: Add an observation with evaluates a template.

data_description.template: A template that evaluates to `True` will update the prior accordingly, A template that returns `False` will update the prior with inverse probabilities, a template that resolves `None` will be ignored.
